content: I have recently wondered, and I think got an answer in the negative: We don't have a way to run the full tests via CI that isn't an attempt to merge to master, right?

(Apart from editing the configuration files so that the try builds include the other platforms of interest and also ... the tests ? is that even possible via the local config files? I assume it is...)
You only need to edit CI config, but that is otherwise accurate.
This topic was moved here from #t-compiler/performance > Perf Runs on Windows by simulacrum
In particular @pnkfelix there's also non-standard defaults on CI, e.g., CI enables compare-mode for LLVM and usually has nodejs installed (so rustdoc tests)..
